metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10318 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A missing authorization check in the fscrypt_process_policy function infs/crypto/policy.c in the ext4 and f2fs filesystem encryption support inthe Linux kernel before 4.7.4 allows a user to assign an encryption policyto a directory owned by a different user, potentially creating a denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
